Package net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm

Class NGMAllocation

java.lang.Object
net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.NGMAllocation
public class NGMAllocation extends Object
Represents the resource allocation applied to a task over time.

An allocation describes how much workforce capacity is assigned to a task at any given instant. Unlike a simple constant fraction, an allocation can vary over time, which is modeled using a PiecewiseConstant function.

The allocation value at any instant is expressed as a Fraction, representing the number of "full-time equivalent" (FTE) resources effectively working at that moment.

Examples of allocation patterns

  • 1 — One full-time person (100% capacity)
  • 2 — Two full-time persons working simultaneously
  • 1/2 — One person working at 50% capacity
  • 0 at certain times — No work during weekends, holidays, or outside working hours

Time-varying allocation

By wrapping a PiecewiseConstant, this class can represent complex real-world scenarios such as:

  • A person who only works Monday to Friday (weekday calendar)
  • A person who works mornings only (08:00-12:00)
  • A person who is unavailable during specific holidays
  • A combination of the above (using Combiner.product())

The LoadIntegrator uses this allocation function to compute how long a fixed-effort task will take, by integrating the allocation over time until the required effort is consumed.

See Also:
  • PiecewiseConstant
  • LoadIntegrator

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static NGMAllocation of(PiecewiseConstant loadFunction)
      Creates an allocation from a time-varying load function.

      This is the most flexible factory method, allowing any PiecewiseConstant to define the allocation pattern.

      Parameters:
      loadFunction - the piecewise constant function defining allocation over time
      Returns:
      a new NGMAllocation wrapping the given function

    • fullTime

      public static NGMAllocation fullTime()
      Creates a constant full-time allocation (100% at all times).

      This represents one person working full-time with no calendar constraints. Work can happen 24/7. Useful for simple calculations or as a baseline before applying calendar constraints via Combiner.product().

      Returns:
      a new NGMAllocation representing constant 100% availability

    • getLoadFunction

      public PiecewiseConstant getLoadFunction()
      Returns the underlying load function.

      This function can be used with LoadIntegrator to compute task durations based on effort and allocation.

      Returns:
      the piecewise constant function representing the allocation over time
